newsitem.title: USA: Osicom to buy Cray unit.
newsitem.headline: Osicom to buy Cray unit.

text.p: Osicom Technologies Inc said on Wednesday it has agreed to acquire Cray Communications, Inc., the U.S. division of UK-based Cray Electronics Holdings for $17 million.
Osicom said the unit is currently profitable, and is expected to add approximately $28 million to Osicom's annual revenues, the company said.
Under the acquisition agreement, the total purchase will consist of $14 million in cash and $3 million in Osicom preferred stock.
The cash payment will be used to purchase the stock of the U.S. division and for repayment of debt to both the bank and the parent company, Osicom said.
The acquisition will be accounted for as a purchase, with the allocation of the purchase price to be determined in the near future.
